page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY_ST.PIRAN.
page.content: St.Piran was a saint who came to Cornwall many years ago.The legend says he travelled on a millstone from Ireland and landed in Perran porth.At this very point he built an oratory,which can still be located today,although it has been covered with sand. St.Piran is also credited with the discovery of tin.Having built a fire place with stones,the legend goes,he then discovered one of the stones had altered to tin. St.Pirans flag is a white cross on a black background_this represents two different things_tin from the black rock,and the light of Christ shining in the darkness of the world. St.Piran remains closely associated with Perranporth even to this day. Arguments still persist,today,whether he is the patron saint of all Cornwall
